'''Myles Hollander''' (born March 21, 1941) is an American academic [[statistician]] who has made research contributions to [[nonparametric statistics|nonparametric methods]], [[biostatistics]], and [[reliability theory|reliability]]. He was born in Brooklyn, New York.<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.ca/books?id=qOs6AAAAMAAJ&q=%22Hollander,+Myles%22&dq=%22Hollander,+Myles%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=p-EFT4O5G8r1sQKb0_yQCg&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAjgK |title=American men and women of science - Jaques Cattell Press - Google Books |publisher=Books.google.ca |date= |accessdate=2012-01-05}}</ref> He is Emeritus and Robert O. Lawton Distinguished Professor of Statistics at [[Florida State University]]. He is a Fellow of the [[American Statistical Association]], the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]], and the [[International Statistical Institute]].
